original_solution_mapping.L1: Jack had 13 more than 8 notebooks for a total of 13+8 = <<13+8=21>>21 notebooks
original_solution_mapping.L2: He gave 5 notebooks to Paula so he has 21-5 = <<21-5=16>>16 notebooks left
original_solution_mapping.L3: He gave another 6 to Mike so he has 16-6 = <<16-6=10>>10 notebooks left

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 3401.
    Returns: the number of notebooks Jack has left.
    """
    # L1
    jack_more_than_gerald = 13 # 13 more notebooks
    gerald_notebooks = 8 # Gerald has 8 notebooks
    jack_initial_notebooks = jack_more_than_gerald + gerald_notebooks

    # L2
    given_to_paula = 5 # gives 5 notebooks to Paula
    after_paula_given = jack_initial_notebooks - given_to_paula

    # L3
    given_to_mike = 6 # 6 notebooks to Mike
    jack_notebooks_left = after_paula_given - given_to_mike

    # FA
    answer = jack_notebooks_left
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Jack had {jack_more_than_gerald} more than {gerald_notebooks} notebooks for a total of {jack_more_than_gerald}+{gerald_notebooks} = <<{jack_more_than_gerald}+{gerald_notebooks}={jack_initial_notebooks}>>{jack_initial_notebooks} notebooks
He gave {given_to_paula} notebooks to Paula so he has {jack_initial_notebooks}-{given_to_paula} = <<{jack_initial_notebooks}-{given_to_paula}={after_paula_given}>>{after_paula_given} notebooks left
He gave another {given_to_mike} to Mike so he has {after_paula_given}-{given_to_mike} = <<{after_paula_given}-{given_to_mike}={jack_notebooks_left}>>{jack_notebooks_left} notebooks left

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: Jack had 13 more than 8 notebooks for a total of 13+8 = <<13+8=21>>21 notebooks
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: He gave 5 notebooks to Paula so he has 21-5 = <<21-5=16>>16 notebooks left
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: He gave another 6 to Mike so he has 13-6 = <<13-6=7>>7 notebooks left

explanation: Incorrect operand. The variable 'jack_more_than_gerald' (value: 13) was used instead of 'after_paula_given' (value: 16).
